intro: Beltrania, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in late spring to early summer. Beltrania is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
